titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Paper Tiger Television Archive
ca. 1981-2008
MSS 276
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Laura Newsome, 2012.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-02-06T12:24-0500

did.abstract: Paper Tiger Television is a non-profit, volunteer-based video collective founded in 1981, which has produced weekly public access television programming that critiques media, culture, and politics. The Paper Tiger Television Archive contains papers, objects, and media that document the running of the organization, the production of the television programming, and all other activities of the collective.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Paper Tiger Television is a New York-based, non-profit, volunteer video collective founded in 1981. The collective has produced weekly public access television programming that critiques media, culture, and politics. Since its creation, Paper Tiger TV has produced more than 320 videos that aim to expose and fight against the corporate control of mainstream media. These programs have been shown nationally on public access television stations, and internationally in screenings and installations.

In 1985, Paper Tiger Television established Deep Dish TV Satellite Network, the first national public access satellite network. Deep Dish TV has since become independent of Paper Tiger TV; however, the two organizations collaborated extensively in 1991 to produce the Gulf Crisis Television Project, a ten-part series exploring many aspects of the Gulf War.

Paper Tiger Television has also been active in social and media activism. Members of the collective have organized several workshops and programs that enable at risk youths and other marginalized groups to have their own voice and become their own advocates. Several of the videos produced through these workshops and programs have gone on to be shown in film festivals and screenings.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Collection use is subject to all copyright laws. Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the Director of Fales Library and Special Collections. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu. or call 212 998 2596.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Paper Tiger Television Archive
Identification of item, date (if known); Paper Tiger Television Archive; MSS 276; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is divided into 10 series. The folders in each series are arranged alphabetically, with the exception of the financial matierials and the photographs, which are arranged chronologically. The series are:

list.item: Series VII: Video - NO RESEARCHER ACCESS
Series VIII: Other Media - NO RESEARCHER ACCESS
Series IX: Objects - NO RESEARCHER ACCESS

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Paper Tiger Television archive consists of the records and materials created and used during the planning and production of the video collective’s programming. The archive contains Paper Tiger TV’s administrative and financial records, meeting notes, correspondence, job applications, newspaper clippings, mailing lists, and publicity for the collective. It also contains photographs of the collective and the production of their shows, audiovisual elements, objects such as backdrops, “crankees” (hand-painted scrolls used to display credits in videos), and props.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.
Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The Paper Tiger Television Archive was donated to NYU's Fales Library by the Paper Tiger Television Collective in 2010.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains the papers created during the day to day activities and administration of the Paper Tiger TV office. It includes meeting notes, correspondence, job applications, newspaper clippings, mailing lists, and all other office materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains materials created for and during Paper Tiger TV's various activities. It is broken up into four subseries. The first, "Programming", contains materials related to the television shows produced by PTTV. The next, "Exhibits and Installations", contains materials created for exhibits and installations PTTV organized thoughout the world. The third subseries, "Workshops and Conferences" contains materials created in workshops and conferences, as well as organizational materials. The last subseries, "Film Festivals and Screenings" contains applications to and programs for film festivals that PTTV had material shown in, flyers for screenings of PTTV shows, and all other material related to the screening of PTTV material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains material related to the publicity of Paper Tiger TV. It has been broken up into two series. The first, "Press", is comprised of published articles, advertisements, reviews, etc. about PTTV. The second series, "Promotion", contains material produced by PTTV for distribution of their programming and other activities, and includes flyers, mailers, and schedules.

scopecontent.p: This series contains photographs from the production of Paper Tiger TV's programming, installations, events, workshops, youth programming, parties, and snapshots of the office and members. For a catalog of the programs, which are listed here by show number, go to PaperTiger.org or browse one of the catalogs in the Publicity series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains the objects created by Paper Tiger TV, which were used as props for their programming and installations. It also includes "crankees" (hand-painted scrolls used to display credits in videos) and backdrops. The crankees are listed by show number. To see a list of Paper Tiger TV shows, go to PaperTiger.org or look at one of the paper catalogs in the Publicity series.
